item.title: Report X-2024100917
item.description:
Report X-2024100917

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-26
  • City: DAYTONA BEACH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DRIVER STATES PACKAGE WAS BEING LOADED INTO PACKAGE CAR AROUND 9:45 AM, ONCE PLACED ON FLOOR OF PACKAGE CAR THE PACKAGE BEGINS TO SMOKE AND MAKE HISSING NOISES THEN "EXPLODED" BUSTING THE BOX APART. DRIVER AND LOADER STEPPED AWAY FROM PACKAGE AND CALLED SUPERVISOR OVER TO PACKAGE CAR TO OBSERVE DAMAGE. NO OTHER PACKAGES WERE DAMAGED AND NO ONE WAS INJURED. DRIVER REMOVED PACKAGE FROM PACKAGE CAR. UPS DRIVER BROUGHT THE PACKAGE IN DUE TO A POSSIBLE LEAK. WHEN THE PACKAGE WAS PUT DOWN THEY HEARD A LOUD NOISE. THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER LEAKED ITS CONTENTS. THIS IS WHY THE GAUGE IS AT 0 IN THE PHOTOS. FIRE EXTINGUISHERS; INNER BOX HAS A 2.2 DOT NON FLAMMABLE GAS DIAMOND LABEL

item.title: Report X-2024100915
item.description:
Report X-2024100915

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-24
  • City: JACKSONVILLE
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS SPARKING AND CAUGHT ON FIRE AT END OF IR5 BELT. LITHIUM ION BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT (POWER UNIT FOR STAIR LIFT) SHIPPER ON HANDWRITTEN SHIPPING LABEL ILLEGIBLE. PACKAGE WAS SMOKING ON THE BELT. THE SUPERVISOR USED THE FIRE EXTINGUISHER TO PUT OUT SPARKS AND FLAME.

item.title: Report X-2024100761
item.description:
Report X-2024100761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-11
  • City: OCALA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Undeclared Hazmat found with a strong odor of gasoline emitting from the package. On further inspection, found a used Sencore Handheld Saw that is gas powered inside. On opening the gas cap found that there was gas left inside the tank. Did not find any leakage of gas from around the cap and cap is not loose when secured. Could not find leakage of gas but there is still a strong gas fume coming from the saw when gas cap is secure. Note: Could not find specs for the specific hand saw. Found specs on a different gas-powered handsaw for section 15a "Inner Material" capacity. Actual gas tank capacity unknown as well as amount shipped inside the handsaw. Tank did not appear full on inspection. Provided SDS for all grades of gasoline since type used is unknown. 15a. Number in Shipment: 1

item.title: Report E-2024100305
item.description:
Report E-2024100305

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-18
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 13:42 PM ET, NMF contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside of a trailer in Hialeah, FL. The spill consists of approximately a quarter of a gallon of Carbothane 134 Part A. which released from (1) 4-gallon metal pail due to a puncture from a nail on the pallet it was loaded on. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spill with absorbents and place the contents into a 10-gallon poly drum.
